question: In PRINCE2, what is the purpose of the Business Case?
options: To define the projectâ€™s approach to quality management
To justify the project by showing it is desirable, viable and achievable
To describe how the project will be controlled on a day-to-day basis
To record all threats and opportunities affecting the project
rationale: The Business Case provides the justification for the project and is maintained to confirm continued viability.
optionRationales: Quality management is covered by the Quality theme and related management products, not the Business Case.
Correct: it justifies the project and supports decision-making throughout.
Day-to-day control is handled via plans, work packages, and controls (e.g., Managing Product Delivery).
Threats/opportunities are recorded and managed via the Risk theme and Risk Register.
